# viewWillStartLiveResize()

**Instance Method**

Informs the view of the start of a live resize—the user has started resizing the view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func viewWillStartLiveResize()
```

## Discussion

In the simple case, a view is sent [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/viewWillStartLiveResize()] before the first resize operation on the containing window and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/viewDidEndLiveResize()] after the last resize operation. A view that is repeatedly added and removed from a window during live resize will receive only one [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/viewWillStartLiveResize()] (on the first time it is added to the window) and one [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/viewDidEndLiveResize()] (when the window has completed the live resize operation). This allows a superview such as [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSBrowser] object to add and remove its `NSMatrix` subviews during live resize without the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMatrix] object receiving multiple calls to these methods.

A view might allocate data structures to cache-drawing information in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/viewWillStartLiveResize()] and should clean up these data structures in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/viewDidEndLiveResize()]. In addition, a view that does optimized drawing during live resize might need to do full drawing after [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/viewDidEndLiveResize()]. However, you should not assume that a view has a drawing context in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/viewDidEndLiveResize()] (since it may have been removed from the window during live resize). A view that needs to redraw itself after live resize should set its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/needsDisplay] property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/viewDidEndLiveResize()].

A view subclass should call `super` from these methods.

## Managing Live Resize

- **inLiveResize**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view is being rendered as part of a live resizing operation.
- **preservesContentDuringLiveResize**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view optimizes live-resize operations by preserving content that has not moved.
- **getRectsExposedDuringLiveResize(_:count:)**: Returns a list of rectangles indicating the newly exposed areas of the view.
- **rectPreservedDuringLiveResize**: The rectangle identifying the portion of your view that did not change during a live resize operation.
- **viewDidEndLiveResize()**: Informs the view of the end of a live resize—the user has finished resizing the view.
